page.title: 18Newburgh - the old Factory
page.content: {Linoleum}used to be the main industry in{Newburgh.}The factory was built in{1891}and{Mr Greig}the founder was a{great benefactor}to the town. The factory was called the{Tayside {Floorcloth Company}and was the{main {employer}with more than{400 people working there. Unfortunately in{1978} the business suddenly{collapsed}and nearly all the workers lost their jobs. It was bought by{Mr Louvell of {Chiltern Herbs,}who kept only a small work force. For a time they produced a little linoleum but nothing after 1980, when part of the factory was destroyed by fire. There is a story in the town that the Council is to demolish all of the factory except the offices and make it into a housing estate. {
